p: Due to the better growth performance, the supplemented deer in this study produced higher amounts of both high- and low-priced meat. However, the proportion of high-priced meat was higher in Group P, mainly due to the higher proportion of meat from the rump. Volpelli et al. [ 11] also reported a higher weight but a lower proportion of meat from the rump in FD supplemented with concentrates compared with those fed pasture.
